direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods generate SQL statements based on input and schema, but 'generate' handles multiple inputs.
Both methods generate SQL statements based on schema, but 'generate' handles a specified limit.
Both methods generate SQL statements, but 'generateStream' returns a stream of statements.
Both methods handle the transformation of input data into SQL values, with 'addValues' focusing on individual fields.
Both methods construct parts of the SQL statement, with 'appendTableInfo' focusing on the table schema.
Both methods handle the transformation of objects into SQL-compatible strings, with 'handleObject' focusing on individual objects.
Both methods handle the transformation of arrays into SQL-compatible strings, with 'handleObjectInArray' focusing on arrays of objects.
Both methods handle the transformation of collections into SQL-compatible strings, with 'handleObjectInCollection' focusing on collections of objects.
Both methods handle the transformation of maps into SQL-compatible strings, with 'handleObjectInMap' focusing on maps of objects.
Both methods handle the transformation of arrays into SQL-compatible strings, with 'handlePrimitivesInArray' focusing on arrays of primitives.
